title: xinetd launched web service fails with accept: invalid argument error
body:
What version of Go are you using (go version)?
1.5

What operating system and processor architecture are you using?
RHEL6 x86_64

What did you do?
xinetd launch a Go web service.

Service code goxinetd.go :

package main

import (
	"os"
    "fmt"
    "net/http"
	"net"
)

func handler(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
    fmt.Fprintf(w, "Hello world")
}

func main() {
    http.HandleFunc("/", handler)

	l, err := net.FileListener(os.Stdin)
	if err != nil {
		fmt.Printf("net.FileListener(os.Stdin) failed: %v\n", err)
		return
	}	
	err = http.Serve(l, nil)
	if err != nil {
		fmt.Printf("http.Serve(l, router) failed: %v\n", err)
		return
	}
}

Append:
goxinetd 10349/tcp 

to /etc/services.

xinetd.d config file /etc/xinetd.d/goxinetd :
service goxinetd
{
	disable	= no
	only_from	= 127.0.0.1
	protocol	= tcp
	server		= <GOPATH>/goxinetd
	wait		= no
	instances	= 20
	socket_type	= stream
	user		= root
	log_on_success	=
}

As root `kill -HUP <xinetd pid>` to get xinetd to reread configuration files.

Run:
wget http://127.0.0.1:10349

What did you expect to see?

index.html file containing "Hello world"

What did you see instead?

index.html file containing http.Serve(l, router) failed: accept tcp 127.0.0.1:10349: accept: invalid argument

strace output:
